greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Concatenation of n consecutive primes starting with the prime a(n) is a prime.
link: Paolo P. Lava, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..250 (terms 1..100 from Zak Seidov)
maple: with(numtheory): P:=proc(q) local a,b,j,k,n; for n from 1 to q do
for k from 1 to q do a:=ithprime(k); b:=a; j:=1; while j<n do j:=j+1; a:=a*10^(ilog10(nextprime(b))+1)+nextprime(b); b:=nextprime(b); od;
break; fi; od; od; end: P(10^4); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Jan 26 2017
results.author: _Patrick De Geest_, _Warut Roonguthai_
ext: Edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 30 2010
